page.title: 15Dudleston Hall (continued)
page.content: They own{22 fields}and the average size of each is{11.5 acres.}The main crop they grow is{grass for grazing and to{make silage.}They also grow{2 {fields of kale}to feed the cattle and some{wheat.}This is the first year they have grown wheat. They make {Vacuum silage}which is quite unusual because it is stored differently. The land is very good. It is{undulating} and {well drained. They own 4{tractors,}a{3 furrow {plough,}a{rotor}for silage,{harrows, a{muck spreader,}a{slurry tank,}and a {slurry silo}for liquid manure. The slurry from the tank and the silo is spread on the fields. The farm they own is really 2 farms combined into 1. Because of this there are 3 houses there. The owner of the farm lives in the main house.
